attributes.action: Compulsory mental health education in school.
attributes.background: We need to promote good mental health practices in the same way we promote good physical health.

attributes.action: More funding for the NHS Blood Donation Service
attributes.background:
The NHS Blood donation service needs more direct funding. 

The service has cut services in the last few years, and regular blood donors are unable to find local sessions to make their donations, often waiting many months. This happens despite the regular appeals to for priority donors.
attributes.additional_details:
Regular donors, even priority donors, often have to wait for months to obtain an appointment to give blood.

The blood donation service has many reasons for an insecure blood supply stock: seasonal demand, lack of new donors, and relatively few donors from certain groups of the population. 

If the blood service continues to cut donor session availability, this could cause serious supply issues in certain vital blood stocks, such as O Negative, B Negative, and A Negative.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to park across/block a private driveway
attributes.background: It seems a large oversight that people have free will to deny people the use of their own driveways by parking across with no repercussions. I myself have had multiple incidents and I’m sure many other people have also and no legal right to get the car moved. I hope to get this changed.

attributes.action: Regulate the transfer of terminally people ill from home to palliative care.
attributes.background: Transfers from home to palliative care usually involve a number of public and commercial services, each following their own safeguarding procedures. However, if serious omissions are to be avoided there is a pressing need for a mechanism which locks these different safeguarding procedures together.
attributes.additional_details:
A central Government initiative, in the form of national protocol or code of practice, would help to ensure that certain standards are achieved by all those involved in transferring the terminally ill from home to palliative care.

Any central Government protocol or code of practice would need to be embedded in the various safeguarding procedures and this should lead to improved collaboration, better communication and a more collaborative way of working for all those involved.

attributes.action: Revoke Section 74 of the LLA Act 2007 that permits the reuse of graves
attributes.background: Section 74 of the London Local Authorities Act 2007 permits a burial authority to disturb human remains for the purposes of re-using the graves, but Cemeteries are failing to locate people who may have an inherited right. The current procedure is not adequate to identify potential owners of graves.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition calls upon Government to develop new legislation in this field to ensure re-use of graves is only permitted where permission from the grave owner or their relatives, as defined by the regulation, is given.

Graves and memorials provide a tangible link to our past, assist genealogical research but primarily form part of our heritage and encourage acts of Respect and Remembrance, but they are currently being abused.

attributes.action: Fix the date for coming out of the customs union and single market for Dec 2020
attributes.background: To stop the Government extending the leaving date of the customs union and single market. That we leave on December 2020 with no more implementation period or extended.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recyclable plastic within 5 years
attributes.background: Every year in the UK we buy around 3.7 million tonnes of plastic as packaging, with only 842,000 tonnes being recycled. We as the UKs consumers find this to be unacceptable for the environment and the future of the planet.
attributes.additional_details: The government has a very complicated 25 year plan to eliminate plastic waste but they could pass a law to ban these products in our shops within 5 years or sooner. Our current government is largely sponsored by big businesses and won’t want to cause them the bother of producing alternatives which won’t destroy our precious world. However, as we elect and pay for these people to represent our wishes it is time we demanded what we want for our children’s future.

attributes.action: Make self defence part of the physical education curriculum
attributes.background: With more and more assaults and the increase of knife crime, I think it should be mandatory that schools teach their students self defence.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017, there were just under 39,600 recorded offences involving the use of a knife or sharp instrument in England and Wales. That’s the highest level recorded over a year since comparable figures began in 2011.

attributes.action: Increase the 5p charge for plastic bags to 10p across the UK
attributes.background: It takes up to 1000 years for a plastic bag to decompose in landfills. Over 100 million marine animals die each year due to plastic in the oceans and other water systems. The 5p bag charge reduced plastic bag usuage by 85% but 2.1 billion bags were still sold between April 2016 and April 2017.

attributes.action: Condemn the Israeli government killing innocent civilians and unarmed protesters
attributes.background: Condemn the Israeli government for killing innocent people like the 21 year old nurse who was shot dead on 1/06/18 by Israeli soldiers while treating injured Palestinian protesters.
attributes.additional_details:
The death of this nurse cannot go un noticed. This killing must stop and there is more the British government can do to ease matters into peace.  

Targeting medics let alone unarmed protesters is a war crime under the ***Geneva Convention***.

attributes.action: Cut Overseas Aid budget by 50% & give £7bn saved to NHS, rather than more taxes.
attributes.background: UK commits to UN target that each country gives 0.7% of GNI (Gross National Income) for Overseas Aid. Only 6 (inc UK) of the 28 participants achieve target - average for all is 0.30% - (OECD 2015). UK pays c10% of total - ie £14bn of £140bn. As NHS is in need, £7bn could save it. Charity at home!
attributes.additional_details:
Source 2015 OECD.

The other 5 countries hitting the target are: Netherlands, Denmark, Luxembourg, Norway and Sweden - all relatively small economies, with positive attitudes to aid.  

The other members of the G8 seem to have an alternative attitude: USA 0.17%, Japan 0.22%, Russia 0%, Canada 0.28%, Italy 0.21%, Germany 0.52%, France 0.37%.

If we went to half of what we currently pay, we'd still be achieving 0.35%; still more than all other G8 members apart from Germany and, marginally, France.

attributes.action: Sugar Levy to be spent in schools educating about nutrition and healthy eating.
attributes.background: The Sugar Levy to be spent raising the profile of healthy eating & cooking in schools. Teaching the next generation how to cook proper healthy homemade meals. It is important to prevent the next generation developing health problems like Diabetes, obesity & heart disease.
attributes.additional_details: As a food teacher we have limited time to teach the basic skills to cook & why some foods aren't good for health. I am a diabetic who didn't understand the health implications of diet until it was too late as an adult. Families now have more than one adult at work, making time for cooking limited. The ease of ready meals & take aways mean people don’t get healthy nutritious meals or understand the risks of eating too much fat, sugar and salt & the quantities they are eating in their food.

attributes.action: Cut the foreign aid budget by 50% and use this money to save the NHS
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis and needs urgent investment. This money would allow for more facilities to be built, more training and recruitment of doctors and nurses, more research and extra mental health provisions. Also, as people are living longer the NHS needs more facilities to help the elderly.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple reports from healthcare experts, RCN, news reports etc all point to our NHS being at breaking point.

attributes.action: Make AED Defibrillators available more publicly (at least every second street).
attributes.background: AED Defibrillators are a crucial part of basic first aid. Cardiac arrest involves a person being on the verge of dying. Cardiopulmonary Resusictation (CPR) is effective but AED defibrillators may double the chance of a person surviving. This could potentially save your or a loved one life.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Heart Foundation, 100,000 people die from sudden cardiac arrest each year. Without treatment, 95% of the time a cardiac arrest results in death. Having a defibrillator in close proximity is vital, as 80% of cardiac arrests occur at home, with every minute of it being untreated the chance of survival falls by 9%. Having a defibrillator in every street or two, and making neighbors aware of it saves valuable time in treatment and thousands of lives!
Sign up to Save!

attributes.action: Repeal the EU Copyright Directive, when the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.background: The EU has just passed, Articles 11 and 13 of the EU Copyright Directive. This could damage and threaten people's right to freedom of speech and expression online, fair use and censor political and peaceful conversation. This should be repealed from UK law on the UK's exit from the EU.

attributes.action: Change in legislation to encourage & support new mums getting back to work.
attributes.background:
PROPOSED LEGISLATION:
1. Mandatory for employers to offer part-time return-to-work up to 3y after birth
2. Give mums returning to work an allowance towards childcare OR:
3. Provide 15h/week subsidised nursery from 1-3 years to cover gap between maternity pay ending and full nursery hours starting
attributes.additional_details: Research has shown that working mums set better examples to their children, and hands-on mums shape more emotionally rounded children. But mums are currently forced to choose between giving up work, not seeing their children, or struggling financially. Becoming a mum is being treated as a punishable offence. To the benefit of creating well-rounded children with strong role models and views of working and earning an income, mums must be supported in being the examples our children need us to be.

attributes.action: Re-introduce National Service
attributes.background: For the good of the country and it’s people, bring back National Service.

attributes.action: Making it law that strobe lights can be used for 3-5 seconds only at a time
attributes.background: I have photosensitive epilepsy which restricts MANY things I wish to do. Including flashing bulbs in supermarkets, concerts, theatre, nightclubs, restaurants

attributes.action: Revise firearms certificates to allow for wider gun access but harder to obtain
attributes.background: We want to see revisions to Section 1 firearms certificates so that law abiding, mentally healthy citizens have the privilege and freedom to own a wider range of weaponry for the purposes of sports and protection of private property.
attributes.additional_details:
The revisions I am proposing are:
Allow for the sale of semi-automatic, centre-fire rifles to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the sale of pistols to citizens with a section 1 firearms certificate
Allow for the protection of private property to be a reason for owning a firearm
Reduce the length of firearm certificate to be reduce from 5 to 1 year so mental health and criminal checks happen more often
Change the price of a certificate to make renewal easy but entry hard

attributes.action: Mandatory registration for anyone doing social work in England
attributes.background: At the moment there is no law requiring everyone engaging in social work to register with an independent monitoring body like Social Work England. This loophole allows for dangerous levels of malpractice to take place inside the system, which could lead to, or may have already caused, child deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
Registration with an independent monitoring body is not a legal requirement for everyone doing social work. Only people calling themselves social workers or using other titles which are protected need to register.
 
There are however, several titles used by social workers which are currently unprotected, leading to cases of families being subjected to negligent care by those who use these unprotected titles to avoid the registration process, and detection.
 
All titles should be protected.

attributes.action: Require UK fashion retailers to sign up to an environmental code of ethics
attributes.background:
Companies trading in the UK should be required to source clothes responsibly.
 
To feed a culture of cheap fashion, companies are ignoring the environmental damage in developing countries.
 
Fashion is the 2nd largest global polluter. The UK is one of the largest consumers of fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC production: Stacey Dooley Investigates Fashion's Dirty Secret. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/5a1a43b5-cbae-4a42-8271-48f53b63bd07

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all domestic Wood Burning Stoves and Log Burners
attributes.background: Every year more people have wood burning appliances installed in their homes to the detriment of air quality everywhere. There is a wealth of evidence available from numerous sources to show how damaging PM2.5 particulates are from burning solid fuels and their contribution to air pollution.
attributes.additional_details: Despite DEFRA's own report (see link) very little is being done to tackle this problem. https://uk-air.defra.gov.uk/assets/documents/reports/cat11/1708081027_170807_AQEG_Biomass_report.pdf  This petition is to force DEFRA to take proactive action and ban wood burning before this too becomes a national health risk, as diesel emissions have become. Under the radar the problem with burning solid fuels has re-emerged due to a totally unnecessary fashion accessory and status symbol.

attributes.action: If a parent refuses child visitation then maintenance should be non-payable
attributes.background: When a couple separate and the resident-parent still with the children refuses any visitation, then the other non-resident parent should not be held accountable for high child maintenance payments when they want to see the children.
attributes.additional_details: Even if they haven’t got any money, the non-resident parent is still hounded to pay without any visitation rights. The stress caused by these situations is at times unbearable yet any non-paying parent is often seen as a bad parent when that’s not the actual case.

attributes.action: Temporary blue badges to be available for those who are incapacitated short term
attributes.background: In 2016 I had foot surgery, I was in plaster cast, followed by a surgical boot. During this time when I was taken to the shops, I was actually more incapacitated than a lot of those who were able to use the disabled parking spaces.
attributes.additional_details: I have contacted West Sussex County Council and my MP in relation to this matter to be told basically that the Blue Badge legislation only currently allows badges to be issued to people with permanent conditions and has a severe impact on their ability to walk and funding.

attributes.action: Take back control of disabled persons services and standardised across the UK
attributes.background: There are many differences between counties in the services that are available. This makes it difficult to understand and it shouldn't be down to your postcode as to which services you can access.

attributes.action: Exempt SME's from GDPR or provide tax allowance to offset the cost of compliance
attributes.background: The introduction of GDPR creates compliance and continuing costs to SME's. It is recognised that implementation has already cost billions, disproportionately for SMES. It seriously damages Export and the Service sectors. An appropriate incentive by a tax allowance to offset ongoing costs will assist
attributes.additional_details: US Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross has stated that the “GDPR “significantly interrupts transatlantic co-operation - creates unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". He expressed his "deep concern" about the EU's latest regulatory nightmare warning it will "significantly interrupt transatlantic co-operation, create unnecessary barriers to trade for everyone outside the EU". The costs do and will fall disproportionately on small and medium-sized businesses.

attributes.action: Change the law so that all food sold in stores has allergy labels
attributes.background: Food such as bakery items made in store that are left on the shelf for consumers to buy do not have to have allergen information. The stores cover themselves by having a small sign on shelf to imply the risk of contamination or ingredients, but the item itself doesn’t contain any such information.
attributes.additional_details: A family member purchased a bakery item and gave it to my child. One hour after eating, my son passed out from an allergic reaction. Had the label clearly showed the ingredients, this could have been avoided. This could have been so much worse had it been another child/person. I want allergy info on all food items.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for there to be CCTV in special and PRU schools
attributes.background: Special needs schools and PRU settings often need to use restraint procedures on children to ensure the safety of children and staff. During a restraint, my son has sustained 16 injuries on his face, neck, arms, legs, chest, abdomen and back. CCTV would ensure that incidents can be investigated.
attributes.additional_details: If schools had CCTV there would be no question about these events. Staff and parents could watch the events unfold and staff can be held to account if needed, or shown to be using resonable force if they were. It is important that there is an unbiased view of the events as when a child needs restraining, emotions run high, as often staff can get hurt. CCTV would show what happened and why and mean that it is easy and transparent to investigate.

attributes.action: Make chain stores responsible for their plastic packaging, i.e extreme fines
attributes.background:
In every shop you visit how many items are packaged in plastic? 

We need to make chain companies responsible for their plastic input to our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Goverment fines: 
• Super Stores/Markets
• Retail Stores
• Warehouses
• Fast food chains
• Delivery companies 
• etc
For the amount of plastic packaging and waste they produce, the UK should see a decline in plastic packaging; in turn this could lessen the companies fines. With the money that it produces this could go towards companies who break down plastics to recycle them, or in to making any plastic waste in to materials to make roads, for example, instead of using asphalt.

attributes.action: Add teaching of CPR and basic lifesaving skills to the teaching syllabus
attributes.background: Many lives could potentially be saved if more individuals within the U.K. knew how to correctly carry out CPR and had the knowledge of basic lifesaving skills. Include these topics in the primary & secondary national curriculum to save thousands of lives.

attributes.action: Remove standardised testing from schools in the U.K.
attributes.background: I believe strongly in the fact that every child is different and deserves to be tested as an individual not as a collective group. Tests are not suitable for every child.
attributes.additional_details: As Frederick J. Kelly, the man who invented standardised testing, once said “These tests are too crude to be used and should be abandoned.” Every child is different which is what they are told throughout school, but when it comes to it every child is tested in the same way, not taking into consideration their abilities and strengths. Tests put a lot of unnecessary pressure on both schools and students.

attributes.action: Childrens social workers to be mental health awareness trained and SEN trained
attributes.background:
Children are ending up in care wrongly, as front line social workers are not equipped with mental health awareness training or SEN trained. 
Reports on emotional harm are written wrongly, resulting children end up in care with complex needs and challenges that are not met until they leave care.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 Children and young people suffer with mental health issues. Though it still seems to be over looked in Childrens social work. They often lack  to correctly identify  a bullied child, a grieving child or child struggling at school because of SEN needs. Families are being split up because of lack of basic training that should be mandatory at University level with a yearly review in the work place.

attributes.action: Be commited to holding a second referendum on Scottish independence after Brexit
attributes.background: I am asking the UK government to be committed to holding a second referendum on Scottish Independence, because it looks like we are heading towards a hard Brexit, which could damaging to the UK and Scottish economies in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
And also here is a list of things she plans to and/or could do do to Scotland:

- take Scotland out of the EU against its will, despite voting overwhelmingly to remain. 
- remove powers from the Scottish Parliament after Brexit. 
- they could close down the parliament and rip up the devolution settlement. 
- wipe out the SNP and other parties completely for good in Scotland. 
- sell Scotland down the river.
The prime minister must regard this as a ‘power grab’ if this is likely to happen.

attributes.action: Pay student social workers on Placement a minimum wage
attributes.background: Pay a basic living wage to social work students who have to do 37.5 hours on placement. Students should receive a fair wage to help support them during their studies as part time work is not always an option and so money is very tight.
attributes.additional_details: University students who have homes/families and bills to pay struggle to maintain a life on a social work bursary. The placement funding does not cover the miles or the hours driving from one clients house to another over 100 days. Most students rely on family members and friends for handouts and childcare to get through the 20 weeks of unpaid work,doing the same role as social workers on £28,000 a year and up in order to qualify with an MA.

attributes.action: To keep the RAF Red Arrows in Lincolnshire after RAF Scampton closes.
attributes.background: The Red Arrows have been in lincoln for years . It's there home and alot of people would agree they should stay in lincoln as that is one of the know facts of lincoln .

attributes.action: Introduce renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in UK for 14 years
attributes.background: The previous immigration law allows anyone who has been in the UK for 14years to be eligible for permanent residence. However, this was removed in 2010 with government view to removing all overstayers even if they have been in the UK for more than 14years.
attributes.additional_details:
However, recent government reports showed there have been no changes to the number of people deported who have been in the UK for 14years or more as these sets of people are either already have a settled family.

In the light of the above, the government should introduce legal renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in the UK for more than 14 years without a criminal record so that these sets of people will be able to work legally, contribute to the UK economy positively and pay taxes.

attributes.action: Issue an official apology to Lauren Southern for denial of entry into the UK
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern was detained in Calais by Kent police and charged under section 7 of the terrorism act, before being denied entry into the UK.

The Government must apologise for this.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that that section 7 was wrongfully applied as Section 41 states that "A constable may arrest without a warrant a person whom he reasonably suspects to be a terrorist." I do not believe that the police believed Lauren Southern to be a terrorist.

attributes.action: Allow pupils to opt out of music lessons on religious grounds
attributes.background: Some muslims believe Islam forbids them to play musical instruments, listen to music, dance and can not play a role in it. As this subject is compulsory on the National Curriculum, some muslims are being forced to go against their religion by schools.
attributes.additional_details:
As parents we have full right over what information is delivered to our children. Muslims should not have to compromise with anyone on what they believe to be clear cut orders and principles conveyed in their religion. So therefore the subject music should be optional. Evidence from the Holy Book (Quran), Allah SWT, says in Surah Luqman, "And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech [music] to mislead [others] from the way of Allah will have a humiliating
punishment". [Luqman 31:6]

attributes.action: Allow the public to carry and use self defence items.
attributes.background: Request that in light of significant police cuts, a steep the increase in violent crime, and a reduction in detection and convictions for violent crime, that citizens be permitted to defend themselves against attackers without fear of prosecution.
attributes.additional_details: To this end, we request that for as long as the current criminal climate exists, that we be permitted to carry items that can be used for, and are intended for self defence, such as night sticks, batons, pepper spray as well as other non lethal items. We feel that the need to adequately defend ourselves and our families becomes a basic right when the police and judicial system are unable to fulfil that duty as is the case at present.

attributes.action: Stop the manufacture and importation of non biodegradable plastics
attributes.background: Our planet is choking on non bio degradable plastics. We need to act NOW and immediately stop the manufacture and importation of these life threatening products.

attributes.action: New powers to take over failing schools
attributes.background: Government and local authorities need powers to take over failing schools. After the notification in March this year to close Plymouth Studio School, it was acknowledged that the secondary school system in Plymouth is failing our children. The Government must intervene.
attributes.additional_details: Six months on and into a new school year, the children from Studio School have been forgotten and the standards of our Plymouth Secondary Schools are well below the national average. Exam results are well below what they should be and although MPs have spoken out, I can see no action or improvements. The promises made to the Studio School children haven’t been upheld and they have been swept under the carpet. The current system is failing our children. The Government must accept responsibility.

attributes.action: To stop companies selling debts to debt collection companies
attributes.background: Want it so companies eg mobile phone companies can’t sell a debt on to debt companies who then add extortionate charges and use heavy handed tactics. The contract is between the company and the person who takes out the contract, making that contract a legal document.

attributes.action: Allow postgraduate students the right to financial support for childcare.
attributes.background: Postgraduate students are not classed as eligible for working tax credits, nor are they recognized as students due to not being in receipt of a student loan. This excludes parents from receiving financial support for childcare that is afforded to working parents or undergraduate parents.
attributes.additional_details: Discrimination of parents wishing to complete postgraduate study means they are financially excluded from completing positions which, if afforded support for childcare costs, they would be able to complete. Following postgraduate study, when in employment they would pay a higher rate of tax and would contribute more to the repayment of undergraduate loans. As it stands parents of young children are financially  better off remaining on income support than pursuing funded postgraduate positions.

attributes.action: Change Child Benefit cap from £60k sole earner to £100k joint or single income
attributes.background: The rules introduced in 2012 that child benefit should be capped at £60,000 are fundementally flawed. A single income of £60,000 means that you are not entitled to any child benefit yet 2 parents working can earn £98,000 and get the full entitlement.
attributes.additional_details: A single earner of £60k will be on a 40% tax bracket with no child benefit yet 2 parents can earn £43k each at 20% and get full child benefit. Families work extremely hard to enable one of the parents to look after their children during their youngest years rather than a stranger but the government seems to want to make this extremely difficult. There is also very little public Information to inform you that you lose this when you hit £60k meaning you end up in debt to the inland revenue.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people living with heart conditions
attributes.background: Coronary heart disease remains the number 1 killer in the UK. Every 7 minutes someone in the UK will have a heart attack and 800,000 people are living with heart failure every year. Despite this heart patients still have to pay for medication which is not affordable for everyone.

attributes.action: Make calls to the Police non-emergency number 101 free.
attributes.background: Calls to 999 are free, but often these are not urgent. Calls to the NHS 111 are free. The public are encouraged (quite rightly) to report crimes, but are discouraged by the cost. If the Police want the public to report more crimes, and to reduce non-urgent 999 calls, 101 should be a free service.

attributes.action: State categorically that Canada has our support in its spat with Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: At a time when Britain is leaving the EU and restrengthening our links with our Commonwealth friends, why have we turned our back on Canada during their assault by Saudi Arabia? We share a monarchy and history, so an attack on Canada is also an attack on us and our way of life.
attributes.additional_details: We should back Canada fully against Saudi Arabia and show them that they are not alone in standing up for human rights in the world. Cowardice and arms sales should never come before long term friends and relations. Many of us have family members in Canada and our history goes back all the way. How embarrassing that our government has put money before pride, morality and friends.

attributes.action: After Brexit - Expats spouses should be allowed to live in the UK without a visa
attributes.background: After the Brexit, British expats should be able to bring our partners/wifes/husbands who are not British to live in the UK without a visa (as in the past being in Europe).
attributes.additional_details: With the current deal for Brexit, if you want to move back, we can get passports for our children but not our wifes or husbands. Our wifes and husbands should be given freedom of movement as our children do. We are families, we shouldn’t be split apart.

attributes.action: Create a voluntary, opt-in, monthly payment that goes 100% to the NHS
attributes.background: Recently, my 2 year old daughter has been suffering from a health condition that we are still looking into. Without the NHS, the treatment my daughter has received and is still yet to receive would have cost me tens of thousands of pounds that I simply could not afford. We all depend on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, the taxes we pay are used to fund numerous different categories including international services, culture and religion to name a few as well as the NHS. All of this information can be found on the .gov website. This proposal would be an additional, voluntary payment that would go solely to fund the NHS.
 
As members of the public, we are quick enough to comment that the NHS needs more funding and investment, this option would put the ball in our court. Something needs to change.
